text: In mathematics, a symbolic language is a language that uses characters or symbols to represent concepts, such as mathematical operations, expressions, and statements, and the entities or operands on which the operations are performed. ==See also== *Formal language *Language of mathematics *List of mathematical symbols *Mathematical Alphanumeric Symbols *Mathematical notation *Notation (general) *Symbolic language (other) ==References== ==External links== *Mathematical Symbols Category:Mathematical notation Category:Writing systems
title: Symbolic language (mathematics)
